DataElement.preferredName: Demographics Diagnosis Patient Census Tract Poverty Indicator Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The neighborhood poverty level of a patient based on the census tract of the patient's address at diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Demographics Diagnosis Patient Census Tract Poverty Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income)._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Relatively permanent statistical subdivisions of a county used by the U.S. Bureau of the Census for purposes of population enumeration. Each tract has a unique identification number consisting of a 4-digit basic number and a 2-digit suffix of the form 1234.56._A subjective and comparative term describing a lack of sufficient wealth (usually understood as capital, money, material goods, or resources especially natural resources) to live what is understood in a society as a "normal" life: for instance, to be capable of raising a healthy family, and especially educating children and participating in society. A person living in this condition of poverty is said to be poor. The meaning of "sufficient" varies widely across the different political and economic areas of the world._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: statistical characterization of human populations (or segments of human populations broken down by age or sex or income etc.).

Concepts.definition: The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).

Property.preferredName: Diagnosis Patient Census Tract Poverty Indicator
Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:Relatively permanent statistical subdivisions of a county used by the U.S. Bureau of the Census for purposes of population enumeration. Each tract has a unique identification number consisting of a 4-digit basic number and a 2-digit suffix of the form 1234.56.:A subjective and comparative term describing a lack of sufficient wealth (usually understood as capital, money, material goods, or resources especially natural resources) to live what is understood in a society as a "normal" life: for instance, to be capable of raising a healthy family, and especially educating children and participating in society. A person living in this condition of poverty is said to be poor. The meaning of "sufficient" varies widely across the different political and economic areas of the world.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Relatively permanent statistical subdivisions of a county used by the U.S. Bureau of the Census for purposes of population enumeration. Each tract has a unique identification number consisting of a 4-digit basic number and a 2-digit suffix of the form 1234.56.

A subjective and comparative term describing a lack of sufficient wealth (usually understood as capital, money, material goods, or resources especially natural resources) to live what is understood in a society as a "normal" life: for instance, to be capable of raising a healthy family, and especially educating children and participating in society. A person living in this condition of poverty is said to be poor. The meaning of "sufficient" varies widely across the different political and economic areas of the world.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

A person living in this condition of poverty is said to be poor. The meaning of "sufficient" varies widely across the different political and economic areas of the world._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
